content.description: A tricky move or two get you to a stance to clip the first bolt.  If you blow this, the landing will not be good.  Consider stick clipping if not solid at the grade.  Continue up a face that gets better move by move to a mantel move on to a ledge.  Continue up the beautiful orange face with flakes, slopers and edges.
content.location: Second bolted line from the right on the Paradox Wall

content.description: Start on a left facing flake just right of an uprooted tree. Climb dirty holds up to a slopey mantle. Take better climbing to the top. You may want to protect the middle with a .75 Camalot.Â
Long route with a low crux on a roof and facey climbing up to the anchors.
content.protection: 14 Bolts and Ring and Shut anchor
content.location: First route from the left side of the wall.

content.description: Long, fairly sustained route with bouldery start and thin finish with lots of jugs in between. Crux at the "roof" near the end and the thin face crimpers at the end.
content.location: Fifth route from the left at the pardox wall.

content.description: This is a fun adventure climb. Pull your way through a relatively tough start to some traversing up and over a dirty ledge. Neat movement and good holds to the top.
content.location: Two lines to the right of Hurts So Good

content.description: A mirror image of its neighbor, Hurts So Good, but a number grade harder. Good jugs down low lead to a tricky section past the middle and the route finishes with facey moves at the top.
content.location: To the left of Hurts So Good or the fourth route from the left side of the Paradox Wall.

content.description: Fun and sustained route. One of the best in this section. Clipping the anchors on sharp holds with poor feet is the only awkward part.
Decent route. Crux is getting off the ground on a wobbly pile of rocks to a high undercling. The rest of the route is fairly chill. Uses the same anchors as Hurts so Good.
content.location: Just right of Hurts so good

content.description: Tall wall with fantastic views. High quality moderate routes. 60 Meter rope and at least 14 draws required.    Routes from right to left.    See the Egress 7   Vividly Grey 9+/10   Hidden in Plain Sight 10a   The Three Gs 10c   Hurts So Good 10a   Girly Man 11a/b   Bad Girls are Good 10b   Republican Conservationist 10c   Republican Give-Away- Program 10d/11a
